title: Retro Apple emulator ported to $60 ESP32 microcontroller-powered touchscreen tablet
summary: A new emulator makes running classic Apple Macintosh 68K software a breeze on a cheap, portable, IoT development kit.

title: Get an entire RTX 5090 gaming PC for the same price as the GPU alone $3,599 rig includes 9700X, 32GB of RAM, and a 2TB SSD in MSI's PC deal
summary: The MSI PC deal includes a $3,599 rig with an RTX 5090, Ryzen 9700X processor, 32GB of RAM, and a 2TB SSD.

title: Micron addresses Crucial exit backlash: 'We are trying to help consumers around the world'
summary: Micron responded to criticism over its decision to exit the consumer memory business and warned that shortages may last until 2028.

title: Asus revised the liquid metal application on its $4,000 ROG Matrix RTX 5090 cards   der8auer says retail versions come with 'much more professional' spread
summary: Asus has revised the liquid metal application on its ROG Matrix RTX 5090 cards to prevent accidental leakage. The updated application features a more professional spread with neat lanes closer to the IHS. This change will improve the overall performance and reliability of the cards.

title: Newegg bundles 16GB of DDR5-6000 RAM with Asus AM5 B850 mobo for under $240
summary: Newegg is offering a combo deal including 16GB of DDR5-6000 RAM and an Asus AM5 B850 motherboard for under $240, with a discount of $169.99 and 41% off.

title: FCC approves 7,500 additional Starlink Gen2 satellites service will benefit from higher throughput and lower latency worldwide
summary: The FCC has partially approved a significant expansion of SpaceX's next-generation Starlink constellation, authorizing 7,500 additional LEO satellites under a partial grant.

title: MetalPrinting Gauss MT90 3D printer offers office safe metal printing without powders uses paste based metal extrusion (PME) tech
summary: MetalPrinting unveiled its next-generation Gauss MT90 metal paste 3D printer at CES 2026, providing office-safe metal printing without powders.

title: Modder saves $130 by building 32GB DDR5 desktop DIMMs from scavenged laptop memory donor modules soldered to bare PCB flashed with custom firmware even run XMP
summary: A modder, VIK-on, built a 32GB DDR5 stick from scavenged laptop memory and a new PCB, enabling 6400 MT/s XMP at a cost of $218.

title: Windows Media Player's find album information functionality has been removed
summary: Microsoft has quietly removed the find album information and update album info online tools from the Media Player apps supplied with Windows 11. Users will need to find alternative software for playing and ripping CDs with relevant track information.

title: US Department of Commerce lifts planned crackdown on Chinese drones, including DJI
summary: The US Department of Commerce has retracted its proposal to stop the import of DJI drones, but new DJI models are still banned in the US due to the FCC's ban.

title: AMD leaves the door open to experimental FSR Redstone support on RDNA 3
summary: AMD has softened its stance on FSR Redstone support, leaving room for experimental implementation on RDNA 3.

title: Upgrade your gaming PC with an RTX 5060 for just $259.99 and instantly pocket $50 in savings
summary: The Gigabyte GeForce RTX 5060 WindForce OC 8G is currently on sale at BestBuy, offering a 15% discount off Nvidia's $299 MSRP.

title: Doom conquers the kitchen through an electric cooking pot classic shooter runs seamlessly after a full device firmware refresh
summary: A YouTuber has managed to run Doom on a Krups Cook4Mec smart pressure cooker after dumping and reflashing the firmware on the appliance's touchscreen control hardware.

title: Nvidia's Blackwell gaming GPUs go through blower-style transformation to fuel AI data centers
summary: Nvidia has released blower-style GPUs for data centers, including RTX 5080, RTX 5070 Ti, and RTX 5060 Ti, with prices higher than retail counterparts.

title: Admins finally get the power to uninstall Microsoft Copilot on Windows 11 Pro, Enterprise, and EDU versions
summary: Microsoft allows administrators to remove Microsoft Copilot from Windows 11 Pro, Enterprise, and EDU versions with specific conditions, including Microsoft 365 Copilot installation.

title: GPU crisis hits Japan as RTX 5060 Ti and up are in short supply
summary: GPUs are selling out as soon as they arrive, with higher-end models becoming increasingly challenging to keep in stock.

title: HP reportedly eyes Chinese suppliers for DRAM as global shortage sparks shake-up   analyst says memory chips are commodities that can easily be replaced
summary: HP is considering buying memory chips from China to alleviate the ongoing shortage, according to a tech analyst. The analyst believes memory chips are commodities that can be easily replaced.

title: Asus adds 64MB ROM to Strix Neo AM5 motherboards, following Gigabyte   capacity large enough to fit pre-installed Wi-Fi drivers
summary: Asus has incorporated a 64MB ROM into its Strix Neo AM5 motherboards to support future Ryzen releases and hold an integrated Wi-Fi driver for new Windows 11 installs.

title: Steam Machine pricing soars past PS5 Pro and Xbox Series X in new retailer listing
summary: The Steam Machine's 1TB version costs $1,070 before taxes, surpassing the prices of PS5 Pro and Xbox Series X. The 512GB model is listed at $950. Both prices are significantly higher than expected.

title: Dev creates selection of UEFI games you have to beat in order to boot your computer  10-month project will shut down your PC if you lose
summary: A developer creates a series of UEFI games with the goal of booting a computer by winning the games, and shutting down if the games are lost.

title: This $2,000 Bitcoin mining water heater can pay for itself by slashing your energy bills, company claims
summary: Superheat has created a water heater that uses a Bitcoin ASIC miner to generate heat, potentially saving users money on energy bills and paying for itself within a year.

title: Jensen Huang discusses the economics of inference, power delivery, and more at CES 2026 press Q&A session
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang addressed topics such as inference economics, power constraints, and open models in a press Q&A at CES 2026.

title: Nvidia hires first-ever CMO, snatches former Google exec for the tough job of helping sell more chips
summary: Nvidia is hiring its first chief marketing officer, Alison Wagonfield, a former Google executive with nearly 10 years of experience building the company's Cloud project.

title: Intel showed up for consumers at the 'Consumer Electronics Show;' AMD didn't
summary: At this year's CES, Intel was focused on pitching its Panther Lake chips to gamers, laptop users, and robot makers, while AMD seemed too focused on AI potential, neglecting its consumer audience.

title: Meta inks deals to supply a staggering 6 gigawatts in nuclear power for data center ambitions enough wattage to supply 5 million homes
summary: Meta is securing 6 gigawatts of nuclear power to meet its data center needs, with 1 gigawatt for Prometheus in 2026 and 5 gigawatts for Hyperion by 2028.

title: Intel Panther Lake press Q&A transcript EVO is still alive, and the company ditches prior-generation naming scheme
summary: Intel's senior staff discussed the new products behind their Panther Lake architecture, featuring illuminating commentary at CES 2026.

title: Researchers turn spoiled milk into 3D printing materials
summary: Researchers extracted proteins from dairy waste and combined them with polymers to create a plastic alternative. This work converts a liability into a potential input for advanced manufacturing.

title: President Trump, Sec. Lutnick praise Intel after the launch of Panther Lake chips says investment in company already bringing tens of billions of dollars for the American people
summary: President Donald Trump and Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick praised Intel and its CEO, Lip-Bu Tan, for the launch of the first chips made using the Intel 18A process node, a step towards the U.S. regaining its lead in cutting-edge chip manufacturing.

title: Intel makes sharp reversal, is 'going big time into 14A,' says CEO Lip-Bu Tan
summary: Intel's CEO expects great momentum in terms of yields and IP on the company's 14A process technology.

title: Chinese researchers hail breakthrough in DRAM-like cells, which could be used in embedded or 3D stacked memory    absence of manufacturing detail casts doubt on mass production
summary: Chinese researchers demonstrated a DRAM-like memory cell with multi-bit storage, fast writes, and long retention. The technology could be used as embedded or stacked 3D memory. However, manufacturability and commercial viability are uncertain.

title: Apple-1 Prototype Board #0 system is expected to fetch $500,000+ at a 50th Anniversary auction and the firm's first ever check is valued at the same amount
summary: An auction featuring 191 lots of historic Apple Computer artifacts has begun, with some items estimated to be worth $500,000+.

title: Woot's 'reconditioned' MSI PC deals might be your ticket to an affordable upgrade
summary: Woot is offering reconditioned MSI pre-built PCs for an affordable upgrade, with a deal for an RTX 5060-based 14400F PC with 16GB of DDR5 and 1TB of storage for $719.

title: Acemagic presents mini-PCs inspired by the NES and PlayStation 1
summary: Acemagic presents mini-PCs inspired by the NES and PlayStation 1, featuring Ryzen AI 9 465, up to 64GB of RAM, and up to 4TB of SSD storage.

title: HBM4 mass production delayed as Nvidia pushes memory specs higher
summary: Nvidia has delayed HBM4 mass production to late Q1 2026 due to revised memory specs for its next-gen Rubin GPU platform.

title: SanDisk to double price of 3D NAND for enterprise SSDs in Q1 2026
summary: SanDisk and other suppliers are projected to increase prices of enterprise-grade 3D NAND due to overwhelming demand from the AI sector.

title: Audeze launches Maxwell 2 headset, with better spatial immersion and bass plus, of course, improved AI noise-canceling mic tech
summary: Audeze launched its new Maxwell 2 planar magnetic gaming headset at CES 2026, with improved audio and mic technology, and swappable side plates.

title: Nvidia to demand full upfront payment for H200 GPUs from China customers, report claims more than two million chips may have been ordered despite uncertain Beijing stance
summary: Nvidia has imposed non-refundable, full upfront payment terms on H200 GPU sales to China-based clients due to regulatory risks. Chinese customers had ordered over 2 million H200 units. This is a precautionary measure to hedge potential risks.

title: MSI unlocks the full power of AMD CPUs with new MEG X870E Unify-X Max motherboard  premium Ryzen overclocking comes to AM5
summary: MSI showcases the MEG X870E Unify-X Max motherboard for Ryzen processors at CES 2026, enabling premium Ryzen overclocking.

title: Keyboard giant Keychron unveils new Nape Pro trackball with programmable buttons
summary: Keychron's Nape Pro made an appearance at CES 2026, featuring a low profile design for ergonomic scrolling without leaving your keyboard.

title: AMD claims Panther Lake has 'too much baggage' for handheld PC use  fights back after Intel jabs AMD for using 'ancient silicon' in its Z2 series APUs
summary: AMD jabs back at Intel for calling its Z2 chips "ancient", claiming Panther Lake mobile chips have too much "baggage" for handheld gaming use.

title: Best of CES 2026: Innovating amidst the RAM and storage apocalypse
summary: Despite the limitations of AI hyperscalers, CES 2026 showcased innovation in laptop CPUs, monitors, and PC cases, despite constrained consumer GPU and storage launches.

title: Creality SPARKX i7 Review: Not just another color bedslinger
summary: Creality's newest 3D printer is not an Ender, or is it? This review explores the features and capabilities of the Creality SPARKX i7.

title: Cooler Master introduces the Aquagate MAX Retro Mini cooling unit delivers massive cooling capacity up to 2,500 watts
summary: Cooler Master showed off a desktop coolant distribution unit at CES 2026. This unit is designed to deliver 900 to 2,500 watts of cooling performance, letting users maximize the power of high-performance desktop systems.

title: Micron to begin work on $100 billion New York 'megafab' imminently
summary: Micron is starting to build a $100 billion site in New York to produce 40% of its DRAM output in the U.S. by the 2040s, after numerous delays.

title: CES 2026 Day 2: Dell's massive 52-inch 6K monitor, AMD unbothered by Intel's new Arc B390 IGP, MSI PSUs guard against RTX 5090 meltdowns
summary: Coverage from Day 2 of CES 2026 highlights Dell's massive 52-inch 6K monitor and MSI's new power supplies designed to prevent meltdowns caused by the RTX 5090. AMD remains unaffected by Intel's new Arc B390 IGP. Various products were showcased.

title: Samsung and Intel co-develop 'SmartPower HDR' for Panther Lake OLED laptops, with up to 22% power savings
summary: SmartPower HDR reduces power consumption by up to 22% in Panther Lake OLED laptops, resulting in 30-40 minutes of extra battery life. This technology enables dynamic voltage control on OLED screens, only drawing more voltage when necessary for high-brightness HDR content. It was co-developed by Samsung and Intel.

title: Boxes of 100 server-grade DDR5 memory now cost as much as property in Shanghai in China spot market  single 256GB server sticks now over $5,700
summary: In China's spot market, vendors are quoting prices that put a box of 100 high-capacity DDR5 server memory modules at roughly 5 million yuan, making a single 256GB server stick over $5,700.

title: Major Japanese electronics store begs customers for their old PCs as hardware drought continues    we pretty much buy any PC  pleads the Akihabara outlet
summary: A major Japanese PC and electronics store is pleading with customers to sell it their old PC gear due to a hardware drought.

title: China expected to approve H200 imports in early 2026, report claims
summary: China is reportedly allowing its tech giants to acquire H200 chips, with Alibaba and ByteDance ready to order over 200,000 Nvidia chips each if green-lit by Beijing.

title: Patriot shows off opulent Viper Xtreme 5 Aurum RAM kit with flashy finish as prices surge throughout industry   company also showcases new SSDs and MicroSD Express card for Switch 2
summary: Patriot showcased its latest SSD and RAM kits at CES 2026, including a sneak peek of their rapid DDR5-10000 RAM kit under development.

title: Upgraded Sipeed NanoKVM-USB USB KVM solution gains 4K 60 FPS video capture and HDMI loop output
summary: Sipeed has released a new NanoKVM-USB with upgraded 4K 60 FPS capture and 4Kp60 HDMI loop output, retaining the same ports as the earlier model.

title: Milk-V Titan A $329 octa-core 64-bit RISC-V mini-ITX motherboard with a PCIe Gen4 x16 slot
summary: The Milk-V Titan is an octa-core 64-bit RISC-V mini-ITX motherboard powered by a 2 GHz UR-DP1000 CPU, supporting up to 64GB memory and M.2 NVMe storage, and featuring a PCIe Gen4 x16 slot.

title: Xibo open-source digital signage solution now works with Raspberry Pi 5 thanks to the Arexibo project
summary: Xibo digital signage solution is now compatible with the Raspberry Pi 5 thanks to Arexibo, an unofficial alternative to the digital signage player for Xibo, designed for Linux platforms. This marks the first time Xibo has been compatible with the Raspberry Pi since developers dropped support for the Linux client in 2012.

title: LILYGO T-Beam 1W An ESP32-S3 + SX1262 high-power LoRa dev board with 32 dBm output, GNSS support
summary: The LILYGO T-Beam-1W is a high-power LoRa development board featuring an SX1262 RF transceiver, onboard 1W power amplifier, and a L76K GNSS module, running on a 7.4V battery.

title: AMD Embedded+ mini-ITX Board features Ryzen AI Embedded P132 CPU, Versal AI Edge Gen2 VE3558 SoC FPGA
summary: Sapphire Technology introduced the EDGE+VPR-7P132, an AMD Embedded+ Mini-ITX motherboard with a Ryzen AI Embedded P132 CPU and AMD Versal AI Edge Gen 2 VE3558 SoC FPGA. It features Zen 5 CPU cores, RDNA 3.5 graphics, and 40 Gbps USB4 connectivity. This represents a significant update from last year's model.

title: XIAO ePaper DIY Kit   EE02   An ESP32-S3 board designed for 13.3-inch Spectra 6 color E-Ink display
summary: The XIAO ePaper DIY Kit EE02 is an ESP32-S3 WiFi and Bluetooth board designed for a 13.3-inch color ePaper display. It includes features like a battery connector, power switch, and user buttons. The board is well-suited for digital frames and information boards.

title: Home Assistant-compatible Makerfabs ESP32-S3-based energy meter features BL0942 energy metering IC
summary: The Energy Meter for Home Assistant is an ESP32-S3-based single-phase energy monitoring and control module that measures real-time power and energy consumption and has remote on/off control.

title: SECO's COM Express Type 6 module features Intel Core Ultra Series 3 Panther Lake-H processor with up to 180 TOPS
summary: SECO has announced a COM Express Type 6 Basic module that supports the Intel Core Ultra X9 series processors, delivering up to 180 TOPS of AI performance. The module supports up to 128GB DDR5 memory, high-speed expansion, and multiple display interfaces. It is designed for rugged and mission-critical applications.

title: 6-core Intel Wildcat Lake Core Series 3 CPUs to succeed Alder Lake-N and Twin Lake families
summary: Intel demonstrated the Core Series 3 Wildcat Lake processors as lower-end Core Series 3 Panther Lake SKUs, featuring a hexa-core design with 2x P-cores and 4x LPE-cores, and 2x Xe-core Intel Xe3 graphics.

title: Quectel SRG091X and SRG093X NXP i.MX 9 industrial AIoT modules integrates Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.4, and 802.15.4 radios
summary: Quectel has released two new low-power industrial AIoT modules based on NXP's i.MX 9 series SoCs, which integrate Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth 5.4, and 802.15.4 radios. The SRG093X features a dual-core NXP i.MX 93 SoC with a Cortex-M33 real-time core and a neural processing unit (NPU) for edge AI workloads. The modules support LPDDR4/LPDDR4X memory, eMMC storage, and various I/O options.

title: MUSE Book laptop review Testing an octa-core RISC-V Linux laptop in 2026
summary: The reviewer tests the MUSE Book RISC-V Linux laptop, which features an octa-core SoC, 14.1-inch IPS display, and up to 16 GB of RAM. The review focuses on the software part, particularly the Bianbu OS 2.3 based on Ubuntu 24.04. The laptop is a follow-up to the review of the MUSE Book Laptop in April 2024.

title: Reolink Floodlight 4K Smart PoE and WiFi 6 security cameras add on-device LLM for natural language video search
summary: Reolink has introduced two new 4K security cameras with on-device Large Language Model (LLM) for natural-language video search, allowing users to find specific items in footage without relying on manual scrolling or cloud-based detection.

title: Intel Core Ultra Series 3 Panther Lake-H CPU powers TGS-2000 series stackable Edge AI computers
summary: Intel unveiled the Core Ultra Series 3 processors at CES 2026, targeting consumer and industrial applications. Vecow introduced the TGS-2000 series, ultra-compact, stackable Edge AI computers with enhanced AI performance using Intel Core Ultra Series 3. The TGS-2000 Series offers up to 100 TOPS combined performance.

title: AMD launches Ryzen AI Embedded P100 and X100 processors with up to 50 TOPS of AI performance
summary: AMD has introduced the Ryzen AI Embedded P100 and X100 x86 processors designed to power AI-driven applications at the edge, with up to 50 TOPS of AI performance and targeting automotive digital cockpits, smart healthcare equipment, and humanoid robotics.

title: Quectel SP895BD-AP AIoT module features Qualcomm Dragonwing Q-8750 SoC with 80 TOPS NPU
summary: Quectel launched the SP895BD-AP smart AIoT module based on the Qualcomm Dragonwing Q-8750 SoC, designed for high-performance IoT applications such as video conferencing and smart retail terminals, supporting 8K video encoding and decoding with up to 3 48MP camera inputs.

title: Nordic Semi nRF54LM20B wireless SoC integrates 128 MHz Axon NPU for Edge AI workloads
summary: Nordic Semi's nRF54LM20B wireless SoC integrates an ultra-efficient Axon NPU for edge AI workloads, delivering up to 7 times faster performance and up to 8 times higher energy efficiency compared to competing solutions.

title: STM32MP21 Arm Cortex-A35/M33 MPU targets cost-effective applications in smart factories, homes, and cities
summary: The STM32MP21 microprocessor family combines a 1.5 GHz Arm Cortex-A35 application core with a 300 MHz Arm Cortex-M33 core for real-time processing, targeting cost-aware edge applications in smart factories, smart homes, and smart cities.

title: Espressif Systems showcases ESP32-E22 Wi-Fi 6E SoC and ESP32-H21 BLE MCU for battery-powered devices
summary: Espressif Systems has showcased its upcoming products at CES 2026, including the ESP32-E22 Wi-Fi 6E tri-band SoC and ESP32-H21 Bluetooth LE MCU for battery-powered devices, featuring a dual-core RISC-V processor and Wi-Fi 6E capabilities.

title: Snapdragon X2 Plus 6-core and 10-core processors target low-power Windows Copilot+ PCs
summary: Qualcomm has introduced the mid-range Snapdragon X2 Plus platform for affordable Windows 11 Copilot+ PCs, featuring 6-core and 10-core processors, 80 TOPS AI accelerator, and 5G modem.

title: Broadcom updates its Wi-Fi 8 access point chips portfolio with BCM4918 APU, BCM6714 and BCM6719 dual-band radios
summary: Broadcom has launched its next-generation Wi-Fi 8 access point chips, including the BCM4918 Accelerated Processing Unit (APU) and two new dual-band radios: BCM6714 and BCM6719. The new chips offer high-performance capabilities, advanced networking engines, and integrated AI/ML inference and acceleration. They build upon previous models with improved features and configurations.

title: ESP32-S3 development board features 4.2-inch Reflective LCD (RLCD), dual microphone array, onboard speaker
summary: The Waveshare ESP32-S3-RLCD-4.2 is a 4.2-inch Reflective LCD development board built around ESP32-S3 with features like Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, dual microphone array, onboard speaker, and temperature and humidity sensor.

title: NVIDIA Jetson T4000 Edge AI embedded system offers 5GbE networking, four PoE camera ports, DIO, CAN Bus, and more
summary: The AAEON BOXER-8742AI is a fanless Edge AI embedded system powered by an NVIDIA Jetson T4000, offering 5GbE networking, four PoE camera ports, and more. It's suitable for high-performance edge AI applications. The system-on-module features a 12-core CPU, 1536-core NVIDIA Blackwell GPU, and 6-TPC MIG VPU.

title: Qualcomm Dragonwing Q 7790 and Q 8750 AIoT SoCs target AI-enhanced drones, cameras, TVs and media hubs
summary: Qualcomm introduced the Dragonwing Q 7790 and Q 8750 processors supporting on-device AI for drones, smart cameras, and industrial vision, AI TVs/media hubs, and video collaboration systems.

title: ESP32-DIV V1 handheld pentesting tool supports Wi-Fi Attacks, BLE spoofing, 2.4GHz scanning, and Sub-GHz jamming
summary: The ESP32-DIV V1 is a handheld wireless pentesting tool designed for hardware hackers and cybersecurity researchers, featuring Wi-Fi, BLE, and RF communication capabilities.

title: GL.iNet Comet 5G A KVM over IP solution with 5G RedCap Cellular connectivity, 3.69-inch touchscreen display
summary: GL.iNet Comet 5G is a KVM over IP solution with 5G RedCap cellular connectivity, a 3.69-inch touchscreen display, and supports remote access even when the regular Internet connection is down.

title: Openterface KVM-GO An ultra-compact KVM-over-USB solution with HDMI, DP, or VGA video input
summary: Openterface KVM-GO is a tiny, open-source hardware KVM-over-USB gadget with HDMI, DP, or VGA connector for headless device troubleshooting and remote server monitoring.

title: Allwinner V861 dual-core 64-bit RISC-V AI Camera SiP features 128MB DDR3L, 4K H.265/H.264 video encoder
summary: The Allwinner V861 is a dual-core RISC-V system-in-package (SiP) with a 1 TOPS AI NPU, designed for 4K AI camera applications, featuring a 4K H.265/H.264 video encoder and 1080p60 JPEG video decoder.

title: WCH CH32H417 dual-core RISC-V MCU offers USB 3.0, 500MB/s UHSIF, and Fast Ethernet interfaces
summary: WCH CH32H417 is a high-performance dual-core RISC-V microcontroller with 5 Gbps USB 3.0, 500MB/s UHSIF, and Fast Ethernet interfaces, along with up to 960 KB flash and 896KB SRAM.

title: Cincoze MD-3000 is a scalable DIN-Rail computer with up to 14th Gen 24-core Intel Core i9-14900 CPU
summary: The Cincoze MD-3000 is a high-performance, scalable DIN-Rail computer powered by up to a 14th Gen 24-core Intel Core i9-14900 CPU, supporting up to 96GB DDR5 memory and various I/O interfaces.

title: Year 2025 in Review, CNX Software stats, and looking ahead to 2026
summary: In 2025, Raspberry Pi released several notable products, including the Raspberry Pi 500+ mechanical keyboard and a 5-inch variant of the Raspberry Pi Touch Display 2. The year also saw the release of the 12-core CIX P1 Armv9 SoC in various boards. Third-party accessories continued to be released for Raspberry Pi SBC and Pico boards.

title: VisionFive 2 Lite SBC Review Ubuntu 24.04 on a low-cost RISC-V SBC in 2026
summary: The VisionFive 2 Lite SBC is a low-cost RISC-V SBC based on the StarFive JH7110S quad-core processor. The review covers the board's features and performance using Ubuntu 24.04. The board's progress is compared to an earlier version tested in 2023.

title: DFRobot HUSKYLENS 2 AI camera review From built-in AI samples to training a custom model to detect elephants
summary: The HUSKYLENS 2 is a next-generation AI vision sensor with a Kendryte K230 dual-core RISC-V SoC, 6 TOPS AI accelerator, and 2.4-inch IPS touchscreen, supporting built-in AI models and custom-trained models via UART or I2C communication interfaces.
